verbose_text: In inflammatory bowel disease mice, there was a reduction of CD4 + T cells producing IFN-gamma, an increased frequency of the putative regulatory population of T cells producing IL-10, and an increment in the frequency of the regulatory markers GITR, CTLA-4, PD-1, CD73, and FoxP3, after treating with glucocorticoid (Sales-Campos et al., 2017).
